it.apice.sapere.api.ecolaws.terms
Interface Formula<Type>

Type Parameters:
Type - The type of the term's value
All Known Subinterfaces:
GtEqFormula<Type>, GtFormula<Type>, IsFormula<Type>, LtEqFormula<Type>, LtFormula<Type>
public interface Formula<Type>

This interface models a boolean condition for annotated variables.

Author:
Paolo Contessi

Method Summary
 boolean accept(Type value)
           Checks the term and decides if represents a valid assignment.
 String getOperator()
           Retrieves the operator used in the formula (as a String).
 String getRightOp()
           Retrieves the right operand of the formula (as a String).
 String getStringRepr()
           Provides a formula representation as a String.
 void setLeftOp(String lOp)
           Retrieves the left operand of the formula (as a String).
 

Method Detail

accept

boolean accept(Type value)

Checks the term and decides if represents a valid assignment.

Parameters:
value - The value to be verified
Returns:
True if condition is satisfied (valid assignment), false otherwise

getStringRepr

String getStringRepr()

Provides a formula representation as a String.

This String should be composed as <left-op> <operator> <right-op>.

Returns:
The representation of the formula as a String

getOperator

String getOperator()

Retrieves the operator used in the formula (as a String).

Returns:
The operator as a String

getRightOp

String getRightOp()

Retrieves the right operand of the formula (as a String).

Returns:
The right operand as a String

setLeftOp

void setLeftOp(String lOp)

Retrieves the left operand of the formula (as a String). This value should be the name of the annotated variable.

Parameters:
lOp - The variable name
